course_title: Special Topics in Language and Culture: El cuento hispanoamericano
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 16 / Seats Avail: 7Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes: Course Description: This course offers an in-depth analysis of modern and contemporary short stories in Latin America. Course Objectives: 1. Understand the singularity of a genre (el cuento) across Latin American cultures. 2. Reflect on the commonalities shared by a variety of writers. 3. Provide opportunities for literary research. 4. Practice individual participation in Spanish. Student Learning Outcomes: By the of the semester, students will be able to: -identify common attributes in Latin American short stories. -recognize the importance of linguistic variants and its contribution to style. -gain the ability to analyze complex literary short pieces. -convey and understand detailed and complex information.
course_description: Study of Hispanic authors, genres, literary periods, cinema, or cultural trends not represented in the regular curriculum. The structure of the particular course is determined by the nature of the topic and the preference of the instructor.
sections: Class Nbr: 4410, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: OXF, Meets: MW 8:30-9:45a, Instructor: M. Davis, Status: Open
